MetaData.MetaDataItem: 1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to remove a device from the Z-Wave network. 2. Once the controller is ready to remove your device, press and release the top button on the smart dimmer to remove it from the network.

Press and release the top button ten times within 5 seconds. The LED will flash 3 times quickly confirming change. Note: This should only be used in the event your networkâ€™s primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable

1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to add the smart dimmer to the Z-Wave network. 2. Once the controller is ready to add your smart dimmer, press and release the top or bottom button on the smart dimmer to include it in the network.

Transform any home into a smart home with the GE In-Wall Smart Motion Dimmer. This Z-Wave device replaces you current light switch using your existing wiring and provides Z-Wave wireless control of overhead lighting. The dimmer enables wireless control of On/Off functions of incandescent, LED, xenon, halogen and fluorescent lighting. Not only does it act as a dimmer but the GE In-Wall Smart Motion Dimmer has a built in PIR sensor which can control the local load and be set in occupancy or vacancy mode.

ChangeLog.Entry: Initial Metadata Import from Z-Wave Alliance Database - https://products.z-wavealliance.org/products/2108/xml

Entry.author: Peter Gebruers - peter.gebruers@gmail.com on behalf of tech165

Value.label: Timeout Duration
Value.Help: Amount of time the light stays on after motion stops

Value.label: Brightness
Value.Help: Valid values are 0-99 or 255 for last dimming level

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: In a three-way configuration, change the top of the add-on switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Reset cycle
Value.Help: 0 = disable 1 = 10 seconds 2 = 20 seconds 3 = 30 seconds 4 = 45 seconds ... 110 = 27 minutes 15 seconds
